name: Provincetown Inn Resort & Conference Center

reviews.text: My cousin & I stayed here from June 3, 2012 - June 5, 2012. We had never been to Provincetown before (from RI) and we found this hotel on Orbitz a month before our stay. It looked nice so we booked it. When we learned the weather forecast was going to be very bad (rainy every day) I called the hotel the day prior to see if we could move up our reservations for another week. The woman I spoke with on the phone was very upset, kind of rude. Told me that they require seven days written notice for any cancellation or postponement. After I read the fine print in our reservations, I was understanding about it, and told her that it was fine, we would be keeping our reservations despite the weather. This hotel is literally on the very tip of Cape Cod. It's very easy to find, you just drive through the center of town, down Commercial St, drive until you can't drive any further and you will drive right into the parking lot. We booked a standard room on the second floor. We had the option to upgrade to a beach front room, but hence the weather forecast, we decided to keep our standard booking. The lobby was impressive & clean. But no one helped us with luggage and we had to climb a flight of stairs & carry our heavy suitcases up the long staircase ourselves. The room was spacious, but standard. Nothing fancy, but clean. There are no smoking rooms, so for us that was a little inconvenient to go down & out the lobby to have a cigarette, but oh well. We really weren't in our room that much anyways, mostly downtown shopping & dining (in the rain!) :-(. The day we arrived it was partly sunny briefly, then it rained that evening and rained for the next three days, and it was cold. I will say that the beach at this hotel is absolutely beautiful, but unfortunately we didn't get to enjoy it. The pool was closed for renovations and emptied out. Supposedly it will re-open on June 6th, the day after we left. As for the walk into town, well it is fairly close. We walked into town once (with umbrellas),and it was a little bit of a hike. It took about 10-15 minutes to walk to the heart of Commercial Street. It wasn't much fun in the rain, so we chose to take a taxi most times, which was pricey because even though it was only a three minute ride, the taxi charged us $7 per PERSON (which for us was $14 plus a tip each way). The continental breakfast was impressive. We really enjoyed it. They had danishes, muffins, bagels, fruit salad, yogurt, a selection of cold cereal (the milk in the pitcher was ice cold), a waffle maker, a selection of juices, a variety of coffees, teas, ect. We ate there every morning and was satisfied, No need to buy breakfast elsewhere. There is a lounge in the lobby, a gift shop, a piano in the lobby. Plenty of large conference rooms with windows overlooking the beach. Honestly, for the price of our stay, you really can't go wrong, The location is decent. The hotel is surrounded by a gorgeous beach. I'm sure our stay would have been nicer had the weather cooperated and the pool was open. But oh well. All & all it was a very nice place. Quiet, family friendly. I would definitely stay here again!! And hopefully next time have nicer weather. :-)
reviews.title: Nice hotel :-)
Did best they could w/what they have
reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference.... Can't beat the location or the views but the hotel is old and cold use some updating. For what they have to work with, it's fine. Some people in the group were suffering from allergies, which could have been seasonal but were still an issue. Most rooms have access to a shared deck, with amazing views.

I stayed there just for one night. That was a great choice. It was beginning of the season so hotel was almost empty. Receptionist was very kind and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean. Huge free car park. Free WI-FI. Complementary breakfast. For us it was a Easter Breakfast. Definitely will stay there again. Hotel is located just few steps from the beach. Great place for weekend escape.
reviews.title: Great location. Amazing place.

reviews.text: From the minute we walked into the inn until the time we checked out our experience was perfect. Hopper the check in clerk was so kind and helpful.
reviews.title: best place 2 stay in p-town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came with an extra person and he found us a larger room with no fuss at all. The room was clean and the view was amazing, cape cod bay and the jetty was right out our front door. Yes the hotel is old but in great shape for having the sea and wind blowing at it for years. The free continental breakfast was good and the make your own waffles were great. Everyone one of the staff we met were genuinely helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Our favorite Cape getaway

reviews.text: I always stay at the Provincetown Inn and I always find it a pleasure! The character of the inn itself with the murals and the lobby is wonderful. The room is always clean and all of the staff are just so nice and helpful. I can't say enough about Dan Hopper at the front desk. His helping me out on a few problems really helped in solving the issues in a quick and timely matter! Thank you Dan !
reviews.title: Great Place with the nicest people

reviews.text: We had a delightful visit to this beautiful Inn! The stunning murals give a history of Provincetown in days gone by. Bonnie G. and Dan at the front desk were wonderfully warm, friendly, knowlegeable and helpful. Lola, who takes care of the lovely common areas and Lennox, who promptly fixed a problem with our door lock, made us feel at home and well taken care of. We are looking forward to many more visits to this special Inn! (The breakfast room is bright and cozy and the breakfast buffet is delicious!)
reviews.title: A Wonderful Visit to a Provincetown Gem

reviews.text: I loved my room, very clean and housekeeping was great. The food was excellent and liked the variety of choices. Erik J. at the front desk helped me re-book my anniversary trip for the end of May. He told me about programs I didn't know I was even eligible for. Very knowledgable.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Erik J.!
reviews.title: Very Helpful Staff

reviews.text: Bonnie G. was very knowledge and great to do busy with. She was very pleasant and informative. Thank you so much Bonnie G. for your help with coordinating our reservation and getting the ocean view room that we wanted.
reviews.title: A very romantic weekend

reviews.text: I'm guessing the 1970s and 1980s were the glory years for the Provincetown Inn. It's a big place, and seems designed for banquets, weddings, and conventions for able-bodied people. You have to walk a long way from the parking area and front desk to the closest guest room. There did not appear to be any elevators, and the rooms are in serious need of remodeling. Examples: I could hear snoring, conversation, and talking from the rooms around me. The bathroom was tiny, and there was no grab bar in the shower/tub. My room had two straight chairs, but no desk and no easy chair. Pillows were lumpy and mattress felt old. The televisions are evidently difficult for everyone to operate; there was a laminated card with instructions for what to do to fix various problems. The restaurant and bar were closed. The place was not dirty, really, but looked rather worn out. That said, the staff was very friendly and helpful, a good breakfast was included with the price, I appreciated having a mini-fridge in the room, and the price was reasonable.
reviews.title: I wish I'd come 25-35 years ago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at the Provincetown Inn every year since the 1970s. We have fond memories of the many enjoyable time we have experienced over the many years at the Inn. The rooms are always well kept and always clean. The entire staff is always friendly, courteous and efficient. The food is always excellent.
reviews.title: Long Time Satisfied Patrong

reviews.text: Over the past 38 years, we have seen the many improvements and upgrades made to the Inn. This includes construction work, painting, new rugs, and drapes, new windows, new heating and air conditioning units, and new bathroom facilities, and cable TV. The room rates have always been and still remain very reasonable.
reviews.title: A horrid experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the Inn is very impressive. The views are all panoramic. They include Cape Cod Bay, the town of Provincetown, the moors, the breakers, lighthouses, various ships, the tides coming in, and going out with various forms of wildlife clearly visible.
reviews.title: "Anticipating our next visit to another world!!!!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn is located only a short distance to town; however, it is still secluded as to provide a quiet feeling of privacy.
reviews.title: BEST TIME OF OUR LIVES !!!!

reviews.text: I ordered a gift certificate for a friends 50th birthday, being in CT I needed the certificate in a hurry-Dan at the front desk stayed past his shift to work out problem and made sure he mailed it that day. I did received it in time! thank you Dan.
reviews.title: Very helpful staff
Great Ocean Views Best Off Season Values
reviews.text: Enjoy the Sunrise, water views, walks at low tide around the Inn, great breakast and just a tremendous off season value. Clean basic rooms and the decks provide a great place to enjoy the Cape Tip. (Water View Inn side) Staff is always friendly, Thank you Roxanne and the Evans Family. JOB Stow, MA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved having a "Cape Tip" room that opened out onto the water. There's a nice little semi-private seating/lounging area for each room and the water is literally 20 feet away.
reviews.title: Spectacular views and nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was also nice being walking distance from the heart of P'town, a gay mecca during the summer.
reviews.title: Affordable with wonderful views
The Provincetown Inn.
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast each morning was extensive with hot and cold options ranging from eggs and waffles to melon and cold cereal. We really enjoyed the ocean view seating area at breakfast.

aka: Provincetown Inn Resort And Conference Center
